job_title: Director of Business Development in East Los Angeles, CA
pros: It’s hospitals are located near freeways and easy to get to work
cons: They pay you very low wages and expected miracles. They allow complacency in various departments. The facilities are run down and nothing is done to fix them.

pros: People are amazing, best coworkers I’ve had, ever.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
cons: Low pay. Unsafe conditions for new grads. No support.  Unsafe staffing. They don’t teach you the correct way of doing things. They don’t follow policies and procedures. They have An ICU ward with no Alines. The nurses aren’t truly ICU certified. When you make mistakes, current admin shows no mercy so you can learn from your them, they fire you and report you to the board, it happened to a few coworkers who are good nurses, a few were just new  with little training just thrown into things they weren’t prepared for but they’ll use you cause they beee a body for staffing purposes ....They give unnecessary c-sections to OB patients who don’t always need it because Medical reimbursement for C-Sections pay better than vaginal to patients who don’t know any better. Some say they were coerced or pressured by the doctor who uses scare tactics and doctors will falsify documentation to make it seem “necessary”. JACHO visits way too often. Doctors still use paper orders cause they are so old they don’t know how to use the Computers no matter how many times you show them

job_title: Registered Nurse in Huntington Park, Los Angeles, CA
pros: Accepts new grads. Most of the population in ER are uneducated and homeless in which this hospital is a good place to get experience to educate patients and learning to speak Spanish. Coffee is free, but doesn't taste good.
cons: Cleanliness is poor. Cafeteria is open for a limited time, but there are vending machines.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Huntington Park, Los Angeles, CA
pros: The only pro here would be that they are willing to hire new grads and ee all know that new grads need their foot in to start they profession.
cons: Not a safe place to work at. Especially if they're not percepting/training properly. The employees are over worked often exceeding there nurse to patient ratio and under payed.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Huntington Park, Los Angeles, CA

cons: Not enough resources and staffing levels can be very stressful. High turnover rate.
